Detailed Description

Handling the pixel types RGB, YUV, and gray.

Typedef Documentation

cvl_pixel_t
 

Type to store a pixel value. It is an unsigned type. The size is machine-dependant, but at least 32 bit.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum cvl_pixel_type_t
 

Type of a pixel.

Enumerator:
CVL_PIXEL_GRAY  Gray level in [0,255]: 0x0000gg
CVL_PIXEL_RGB  RGB values, each in [0,255]: 0xrrggbb
CVL_PIXEL_YUV  YUV values, with Y in [16,235], U and V in [16,240]: 0xyyuuvv. When both U and V are 128, the pixel represents a graylevel.

Function Documentation

cvl_pixel_t cvl_pixel_clip (  int  x  ) 
 

Parameters:
x The integer.
Returns:
0 if x < 0, 255 if x > 255, x itself in all other cases.
Clips an integer to [0,255].

cvl_pixel_t cvl_pixel_clamp (  int  xmin,
int  xmax,
int  x
) 
 

Parameters:
xmin Lower bound for x.
xmax Higher bound for x.
x The integer.
Returns:
f(x) where f transforms [xmin,xmax] into [0,255] in the obvious way.
Transforms an integer into [0,255].

cvl_pixel_t cvl_pixel_gray (  cvl_pixel_t  gray  ) 
 

Parameters:
gray The gray value.
Returns:
The gray pixel.
Constructs a gray pixel from the given gray value. This does nothing more than to ensure that the returned value is in [0,255]. If gray was a valid gray pixel before, it will be returned unchanged.
